segments.text: The House votes on releasing the Epstein files today.
segments.translation: 众议院今天将投票决定是否公开爱泼斯坦的文件。

segments.text: People on hand include women who accused Jeffrey Epstein of abusing them as minors.
segments.translation: 在场的还有一些女性，她们指控杰弗里·爱泼斯坦在她们未成年时对她们进行虐待。

segments.text: This idea that, no, there's nothing more to see here, we don't buy it.
segments.translation: 这种说法，认为这里没什么好看的，我们可不这么想。

segments.text: Ami Martinez with Steve Inskeep, and this is Up First from NPR News.
segments.translation: 艾米·马丁内斯与史蒂夫·因斯基普，这里是NPR新闻的《优先报道》。

segments.text: Republican lawmaker Marjorie Taylor Greene asks if the president has lost sight of his own agenda.
segments.translation: 共和党议员玛乔丽·泰勒·格林质疑总统是否忘记了他自己的议程。

segments.text: I think that the American people deserve to be put first.
segments.translation: 我认为美国人民应该被放在首位。

segments.text: That's what Make America Great again meant to me.
segments.translation: 这对我来说就是“让美国再次伟大”的意义。

segments.text: The president has disowned a lawmaker who was one of his loudest allies.
segments.translation: 总统抛弃了曾经是他最坚定支持者之一的立法者。

segments.text: What does this divide mean for the MAGA movement?
segments.translation: 这次分歧对MAGA运动意味着什么？

segments.text: Also, President Trump welcomes the ruler of Saudi Arabia to the White House today.
segments.translation: 今天，特朗普总统欢迎沙特阿拉伯的统治者莅临白宫。

segments.text: What does the president want from the Saudis, and what do they want from him?
segments.translation: 总统想从沙特获得什么，他们又想从他那得到什么呢？

segments.text: Stay with us.
segments.translation: 请继续关注我们。

segments.text: We've got the news you need to start your day.
segments.translation: 我们为你准备了开始一天所需的新闻。

segments.text: Our Common Nature is a musical journey with Yo-Yo Ma and me, Ana Gonzalez, through this complicated country.
segments.translation: 《我们的共同本性》是我，安娜·冈萨雷斯，与大名鼎鼎的大提琴家马友友一起，带您踏上一段音乐之旅，探索这个复杂的国家。

segments.text: We go into caves, onto boats and up mountain trails to meet people, hear their stories, and of course, play some music.
segments.translation: 我们进入洞穴，登上船只，沿着山间小径去见人们，倾听他们的故事，当然，还会奏上一些音乐。

segments.text: All to reconnect to nature.
segments.translation: 所有这一切都是为了重新与自然连接。

segments.text: Listen to Our Common Nature from WNYC, wherever you get podcasts.
segments.translation: 在你常用的播客平台上收听WNYC的《我们的共同自然》。

segments.text: This is Ira Glass of This American Life.
segments.translation: 这里是《美国生活》的艾拉·格拉斯。

segments.text: Do you know our show?
segments.translation: 你知道我们的节目吗？

segments.text: Okay, well either way, I'm gonna tell you about it.
segments.translation: 好的，无论如何，我都要跟你讲一下。

segments.text: We make stories that hopefully pull you in at the beginning with funny moments and feelings and people in surprising situations and then you just wanna find out what is gonna happen and cannot stop listening.
segments.translation: 我们制作的故事希望能在开头就吸引你，带来搞笑的瞬间和情感，以及让人在意想不到的情况下遇到的人。然后你只会想知道接下来会发生什么，完全停不下来。

segments.text: That's right, I'm talking about stories that make you miss appointments.
segments.translation: 没错，我说的就是那些让你错过约会的故事。

segments.text: This American Life, wherever you get your podcasts.
segments.translation: 《美国生活》，在你获取播客的任何地方。

segments.text: Hey, it's Ray from Car Talk.
segments.translation: 嘿，我是《汽车杂谈》的雷。

segments.text: Are you tired of all the depth and thoughtful care that goes into NPR shows?
segments.translation: 你是不是对NPR节目中那些深刻和细致的关怀感到厌倦了？

segments.text: Want some good old-fashioned goofing around and stumbling to figure out what's going on?
segments.translation: 想要一点老派的胡闹和试图搞明白发生了什么吗？

segments.text: Well, I've been taking occasional car questions again.
segments.translation: 好吧，我又开始偶尔回答一些车子的问题了。

segments.text: You can hear them by signing up for NPR+, along with lots of other bonus content.
segments.translation: 你可以通过注册NPR+来收听他们的节目，还有很多其他的额外内容。

segments.text: Just go to plus.npr.org.
segments.translation: 直接访问 plus.npr.org。

segments.text: The House of Representatives is expected to vote today to release documents related to the convicted sex offender, Jeffrey Epstein.
segments.translation: 众议院预计今天将投票决定是否公开与已定罪性犯罪者杰弗里·爱泼斯坦有关的文件。

segments.text: The House vote alone would not do the job, but it would be a victory for people who want to see the Justice Department files on Epstein.
segments.translation: 众议院的投票本身并不足以解决问题，但这对于希望看到美国司法部关于爱泼斯坦的文件的人来说，将是一次胜利。

segments.text: He was believed to have abused many minors before his death in 2019.
segments.translation: 他在2019年去世前 believed to 滥用过许多未成年人。

segments.text: The Justice Department said earlier this year there was nothing worth releasing.
segments.translation: 司法部在今年早些时候表示，没有值得公开的文件。

segments.text: People who doubt this include Annie Farmer, one of Epstein's accusers, who spoke yesterday on NPR's Morning Edition.
segments.translation: 对此表示怀疑的人包括安妮·法默（Annie Farmer），她是爱泼斯坦的指控者之一，昨天在国家公共广播电台的《早间版》节目中发言。

segments.text: there's a piece about accountability, wanting people that not just participated in these crimes, but also that allowed them, that funded them, that looked the other way.
segments.translation: 这涉及到问责的问题，不仅是那些参与这些犯罪的人，还有那些允许这些犯罪发生的人、资助这些犯罪的人，以及那些选择视而不见的人。

segments.text: I think there's a reckoning for all of that that needs to happen.
segments.translation: 我认为对此都需要有一个清算。

segments.text: And so this idea that, no, there's nothing more to see here, we don't buy it.
segments.translation: 所以这种“这里没有更多可看的”想法，我们可不买账。

segments.text: MPR congressional correspondent Barbara Sprunt is with us.
segments.translation: 国会记者巴巴拉·斯普朗特与我们在一起。

segments.text: Barbara, so how does this congressional action work?
segments.translation: 巴巴拉，那么这个国会行动是怎么回事呢？

segments.text: Well, it would compel the Justice Department to release all unclassified files.
segments.translation: 这将迫使司法部公开所有未分类的文件。

segments.text: So that's records, documents, communications, all investigation materials, essentially within 30 days.
segments.translation: 所以，这就包括记录、文件、通讯，基本上所有的调查材料，都会在30天内公开。

segments.text: And that includes documents related to Epstein's death.
segments.translation: 这也包括与爱泼斯坦死相关的文件。

segments.text: As a reminder, the administration has already released thousands of files to the House Oversight Committee.
segments.translation: 提醒一下，政府已经向众议院监督委员会提交了数千份文件。

segments.text: documents that also include names of other people connected to Epstein, but there are still more files that haven't been made public.
segments.translation: 这些文件还包括与爱泼斯坦相关的其他人的名字，但仍有更多文件尚未公开。

segments.text: And there is renewed interest in this.
segments.translation: 对此再次引起了关注。

segments.text: Democrats on the panel recently released emails where Epstein told a journalist
segments.translation: 该小组的民主党成员最近发布了电子邮件，邮件中爱泼斯坦告诉一位记者

segments.text: President Trump, quote, knew about the girls, unquote, seemingly referring to the people Epstein was allegedly trafficking.
segments.translation: 特朗普总统曾提到，他“知道这些女孩”，似乎是在指爱泼斯坦 allegedly 进行贩卖的那些人。

segments.text: The president has previously said he had a falling out with Epstein many years ago, and he has not been tied to any wrongdoing.
segments.translation: 总统之前曾表示，他与爱泼斯坦之间在许多年前发生过争执，并且他与任何不当行为无关。

segments.text: All right.
segments.translation: 好的。

segments.text: So say this passes the House, the files still would have a few steps to go before they're made public.
segments.translation: 如果这项提案在众议院通过，那么这些文件仍然需要经过几个步骤才能公开。

segments.text: That's right.
segments.translation: 没错。

segments.text: And there are a few question marks here.
segments.translation: 这里面还有一些问号。

segments.text: What is the scope of what's in these files?
segments.translation: 这些文件的内容范围是什么？

segments.text: We know that the measure gives some latitude to the Justice Department to withhold or redact portions of them.
segments.translation: 我们知道，这项措施给予司法部一定的权限，可以保留或删减其中的部分内容。

segments.text: including documents that could jeopardize active investigations.
segments.translation: 包括可能会危及正在进行的调查的文件。

segments.text: So could that lead to delays?
segments.translation: 那这会导致延误吗？

segments.text: President Trump has already called for an investigation into Epstein's alleged ties to prominent Democrats, for example.
segments.translation: 特朗普总统已经呼吁对爱泼斯坦与一些知名民主党人的 alleged 联系进行调查。

segments.text: And another big question mark is the Senate.
segments.translation: 而另一个大问号就是参议院。

segments.text: Will leadership bring this for a vote in that chamber?
segments.translation: 领导层会把这个议题带到参议院投票吗？

segments.text: I think if there's a lot of support from Republicans in the House, it ups the chances of this moving in the Senate.
segments.translation: 我认为如果众议院的共和党支持很多，这样在参议院推进的机会就会增加。

segments.text: So after the House, after the Senate, then it goes to President Trump's desk.
segments.translation: 所以在众议院之后，参议院通过后，这个文件就会送到特朗普总统的办公桌上。

segments.text: That's right.
segments.translation: 没错。

segments.text: And he has said that he would sign it if it comes to his desk.
segments.translation: 他已经表示，如果这项法案送到他桌上，他会签署。

segments.text: But an interesting element in this, he already has the authority to direct the Justice Department to release documents.
segments.translation: 但是在这一点上，有一个有趣的元素，他已经有权指示司法部公开文件。

segments.text: He did that in other cases with documents related to the investigations of the assassinations of the Kennedys and Martin Luther King Jr., for example.
segments.translation: 他在其他案件中也这样做过，例如与肯尼迪刺杀事件和马丁·路德·金的调查相关的文件。

segments.text: But that's not what's happening here.
segments.translation: 但这并不是这里发生的事情。

segments.text: Instead, the House is forcing a vote that would compel the administration to release the documents.
segments.translation: 相反，众议院正在强迫投票，要求政府公开这些文件。

segments.text: Big difference.
segments.translation: 很大的区别。

segments.text: Yeah, that was a major U-turn.
segments.translation: 是啊，这真是个重大转变。

segments.text: I think it speaks to how important this issue is to the base.
segments.translation: 我认为这表明这个问题对基础选民有多重要。

segments.text: I think it's notable that there was a pressure campaign from the White House to convince key Republicans, including some of his most vocal supporters, no less, not to sign the petition to force a vote on this.
segments.translation: 我觉得值得注意的是，白宫曾施加压力，试图说服关键的共和党人，包括一些最为强烈的支持者，不要签署这项迫使投票的请愿书。

segments.text: That didn't work.
segments.translation: 那并没有奏效。

segments.text: And to me, it shows that this is an area where the president doesn't have a firm grip on the House.
segments.translation: 在我看来，这表明总统在众议院的掌控并不牢固。

segments.text: I think the writing was on the wall that a lot of Republican House members were prepared to vote yes for this, with or without the White House's blessing.
segments.translation: 我认为很明显，许多共和党众议院议员已经准备好投票支持这一提案，无论白宫是否赞同。

segments.text: So the precedents about FACE could be a way of giving the go-ahead to something that was already coming.
segments.translation: 关于FACE的先例可能是一种对已经在进行中的事情的批准。

segments.text: That's NPR's Barbara Sprunt.
segments.translation: 这是NPR的巴巴拉·斯普朗特。

segments.text: Thanks a lot.
segments.translation: 非常感谢。

segments.text: Thank you.
segments.translation: 谢谢。

segments.text: Okay, so how did one of the president's devoted allies in Congress become a critic?
segments.translation: 好吧，总统的一位忠诚盟友是怎么变成批评者的呢？

segments.text: Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene has questioned Trump's approach to foreign and domestic policy.
segments.translation: 众议员玛乔丽·泰勒·格林质疑特朗普在外交和国内政策上的做法。

segments.text: Now part of her disagreement grows out of the Epstein files.
segments.translation: 现在，她的部分分歧源自于关于爱泼斯坦的文件。

segments.text: She objected after the Justice Department decided not to release them, but her differences are broader than that.
segments.translation: 她对司法部决定不公开这些文件表示反对，但她的分歧不仅仅在于此。

segments.text: The president calls Greene, quote, a traitor.
segments.translation: 总统称格林为“叛徒”。

segments.text: Greene says it's Trump who has betrayed the agenda he ran on.
segments.translation: 格林表示，背叛她所倡导议程的正是特朗普。

segments.text: NPR Stephen Fowler is here to explain this.
segments.translation: NPR的斯蒂芬·福勒在这里为我们解读这个问题。

segments.text: Hey there, Stephen.
segments.translation: 嗨，斯蒂芬。

segments.text: Good morning.
segments.translation: 早上好。

segments.text: Okay, so she rose as a huge Trump supporter.
segments.translation: 好的，她成为了特朗普的坚定支持者。

segments.text: What happened?
segments.translation: 发生了什么？

segments.text: Well, for the last five years, Trump and Green have had one of the strongest relationships on Capitol Hill, but every relationship has its ups and downs.
segments.translation: 在过去五年里，特朗普和格林在国会山建立了最强的关系之一，但每段关系都会有起伏。

segments.text: In this moment, Trump campaigned on releasing all of the Department of Justice files pertaining to Epstein to uncover what some call a vast conspiracy about powerful figures in government hiding the truth about child sex abuse.
segments.translation: 此刻，特朗普在竞选时承诺公开所有与爱泼斯坦相关的司法部文件，以揭示一些人所称的关于政府中权势人物掩盖儿童性虐待真相的巨大阴谋。

segments.text: But this year, Trump has done the opposite.
segments.translation: 但今年，特朗普却反其道而行。

segments.text: He's stonewalled the release and insulted Republicans who want more information, leaving some MAGA conservatives unhappy with certain aspects of his presidency so far.
segments.translation: 他阻挠文件的公开，并对那些想要更多信息的共和党人表现出了不屑，导致一些支持“让美国再次伟大”运动的保守派对他迄今为止的总统任期感到不满。

segments.text: Oh, this is interesting.
segments.translation: 哦，这很有意思。

segments.text: You just spoke in the plural, MAGA conservatives.
segments.translation: 你刚才用了复数，指的是MAGA保守派。

segments.text: Is Green expressing something broader in Trump's base?
segments.translation: 格林是在表达特朗普支持者中更广泛的问题吗？

segments.text: Well, there have been several instances where some on the right say the president hasn't delivered on domestic priorities that make America great again.
segments.translation: 嗯，右翼的一些人曾多次指出，特朗普总统没有兑现那些让美国再次伟大的国内优先事项。

segments.text: And for almost every instance, there's Marjorie Taylor Greene articulating that disconnect.
segments.translation: 几乎每次都能听到玛乔丽·泰勒·格林在表达这种与特朗普之间的错位感。

segments.text: Like in June when the U.S. bombed Iran, she went on Steve Bannon's War Room show.
segments.translation: 就像在六月美国轰炸伊朗时，她上了史蒂夫·班农的《战争室》节目。

segments.text: Six months in, Steve, and here we are turning back on the campaign promises and we bombed Iran on behalf of Israel.
segments.translation: 六个月过去了，史蒂夫，我们现在又回头践踏竞选承诺，竟然是为了以色列对伊朗发动了轰炸。

segments.text: In August, she called Israel's war in Gaza a genocide, has questioned the effectiveness of mass deportations and trade wars, and has been one of the few Republicans in Congress to say that Trump might not always be right.
segments.translation: 在八月，她称以色列在加沙的战争为种族灭绝，质疑大规模驱逐和贸易战的有效性，并且是国会中少数几位认为特朗普并不总是正确的共和党人之一。

segments.text: Well, what has the president said about her?
segments.translation: 那么，总统对此有什么评论呢？

segments.text: Over the last few weeks, Steve, there were signs that Trump would eventually lash out online and basically disown her politically.
segments.translation: 在过去几周，史蒂夫，有迹象表明特朗普最终会在网上发怒，并在政治上基本上抛弃她。

segments.text: He said this last week in the Oval Office.
segments.translation: 他上周在椭圆形办公室这样说。

segments.text: I don't know what happened to Marjorie.
segments.translation: 我不知道玛乔里的情况怎么样。

segments.text: She's a nice woman, but I don't know what happened.
segments.translation: 她是个不错的女人，但我不知道发生了什么。

segments.text: She's lost her way, I think.
segments.translation: 我觉得她迷失了方向。

segments.text: But as we mentioned, Green is not the only Republican wondering if it's Trump who's lost his way.
segments.translation: 但正如我们所提到的，格林并不是唯一一个怀疑特朗普是否迷失方向的共和党人。

segments.text: Here's what Green said in a CNN interview Sunday.
segments.translation: 格林在周日的CNN采访中这样说道。

segments.text: I think that the American people deserve to be put first.
segments.translation: 我认为美国人民应该被放在首位。

segments.text: That's what Make America Great Again meant to me.
segments.translation: 这就是“让美国再次伟大”对我而言的意义。

segments.text: And I think that President Trump can do that if he refocuses his effort.
segments.translation: 我认为特朗普总统如果重新聚焦精力，就能够做到这一点。

segments.text: I'm remembering a very different politician when she ran for Congress in Georgia in 2020, and you were around.
segments.translation: 我记得她在2020年竞选乔治亚州国会议员时，展现出的形象与现在非常不同，而那时候你也在场。

segments.text: Is this a big change in her politics?
segments.translation: 她的政治立场有什么大的变化吗？

segments.text: This is important to reiterate, Steve.
segments.translation: 这一点非常重要，史蒂夫。

segments.text: Marjorie Taylor Greene has remained ideologically consistent from day one.
segments.translation: 玛乔丽·泰勒·格林从一开始就保持了意识形态的一致性。

segments.text: Unlike others who've criticized Trump and moved away from the Republican Party, Marjorie Taylor Greene is still one of the most conservative members of Congress.
segments.translation: 与那些批评特朗普并逐渐远离共和党的其他人不同，玛乔丽·泰勒·格林仍然是国会中最保守的成员之一。

segments.text: At last year's Republican National Convention, she called Trump the, quote, founding father of the America First movement.
segments.translation: 在去年的共和党全国大会上，她称特朗普为“美国优先”运动的创始父亲。

segments.text: Now what you're seeing is the assertion that founding father does not equal sole arbiter of what that movement looks like.
segments.translation: 现在你看到的 assertion 是，创始父亲并不等于这个运动的唯一裁决者。

segments.text: What does that suggest then for the movement in the future?
segments.translation: 那么这对未来的运动意味着什么呢？

segments.text: Trump has dominated the Republican party for a decade by creating a big tent of different and sometimes conflicting ideological groups and getting them to agree to his views and priorities or else.
segments.translation: 特朗普通过建立一个融合不同且有时存在冲突的意识形态团体的大帐篷，主导了共和党十年之久，并让他们接受他的观点和优先事项，否则就会面临后果。

segments.text: That's starting to change especially as Trump faces record unpopularity and continues to break with his base's idea of conservatism
segments.translation: 这开始发生变化，尤其是特朗普面临前所未有的低支持率，并继续与他支持者的保守主义理念产生分歧。

segments.text: There's always going to be this question of what a post-Trump GOP looks like, but Marjorie Taylor Greene is forcing Republicans to confront that question much earlier than they'd planned and with much less certainty about the possible directions.
segments.translation: 关于后特朗普时代的共和党究竟会是什么样子，这个问题始终存在。但是玛乔丽·泰勒·格林正迫使共和党人比他们原本计划的更早地面对这个问题，并且对可能的发展方向充满了不确定性。

segments.text: And Mayor Stephen Fowler, thanks so much, sir.
segments.translation: 斯蒂芬·福勒市长，非常感谢您，先生。

segments.text: Thank you.
segments.translation: 谢谢。

segments.text: President Trump hosts Saudi Arabia's crown prince at the White House today.
segments.translation: 特朗普总统今天在白宫接待沙特阿拉伯王储。

segments.text: Yeah, the two have major deals to announce.
segments.translation: 是的，他们有重大的交易要宣布。

segments.text: Underpinning it all, though, are the close personal ties between the two men, ties that held even after the killing of a top Saudi critic and Washington Post columnist seven years ago.
segments.translation: 不过，支撑这一切的，是两人之间紧密的个人关系，这份关系在七年前一位沙特批评者和《华盛顿邮报》专栏作家的谋杀事件后仍然保持不变。

segments.text: NPR's Aya Batrao, who is based in the Gulf, has been following the crown prince in other matters.
segments.translation: NPR的Aya Batrao驻扎在海湾地区，一直在关注王储在其他事务上的动态。

segments.text: Good morning.
segments.translation: 早上好。

segments.text: Good morning, Steve.
segments.translation: 早上好，史蒂夫。

segments.text: OK, so what are the two leaders expecting to announce and discuss?
segments.translation: 好的，那么这两位领导人预计将宣布和讨论什么呢？

segments.text: Well, the biggest deal that's being eyed right now by Prince Mohammed bin Salman isn't actually more billions in weapons sales.
segments.translation: 好吧，穆罕默德·本·萨勒曼王子目前最看重的并不是更多的武器销售，而是美国对该地区一系列威胁的保证。

segments.text: He has enough of those.
segments.translation: 他已经有足够多了。

segments.text: What he wants is a U.S. guarantee against a range of threats in the region.
segments.translation: 他想要的是美国针对该地区一系列威胁的保障。

segments.text: And that means a coveted U.S. defense pact similar to the one Trump signed with Qatar recently after it was attacked by both Iran and Israel over the summer.
segments.translation: 这意味着一个令人向往的美国防御协议，类似于特朗普最近与卡塔尔签署的协议，此前卡塔尔在夏季遭到伊朗和以色列的攻击。

segments.text: And this is not a defense treaty, so it doesn't need Congress to approve it and it is less binding.
segments.translation: 这不是一项防御条约，因此不需要国会的批准，而且约束力较小。

segments.text: But it does offer Saudi Arabia guarantees that the US would use military measures if necessary to respond if it's attacked.
segments.translation: 但这确实向沙特阿拉伯提供了保证，表示如果沙特受到攻击，美国将视情况采取军事措施回应。

segments.text: And that did not happen under Trump's first term when Saudi oil facilities were bombed by Iranian missiles and drones from Yemen.
segments.translation: 在特朗普的第一任期内并没有发生这种情况，当时沙特的石油设施遭到来自也门的伊朗导弹和无人机的攻击。

segments.text: Now, another deal being eyed is a defense deal, but it's unlike any before.
segments.translation: 现在，另一个备受关注的交易是国防协议，但这与以往的任何协议都不同。

segments.text: The Crown Prince wants advanced F-35 jets that currently only Israel flies in the Mideast.
segments.translation: 王储希望获得先进的F-35战斗机，目前只有以色列在中东地区使用这种飞机。

segments.text: And the Saudis also want a U.S. civilian nuclear technology transfer and advanced AI chips.
segments.translation: 沙特方面还希望获得美国的民用核技术转让和先进的人工智能芯片。

segments.text: And for all of this, Steve, the Prince says he's ready to invest $600 billion or more into the U.S. under Trump.
segments.translation: 而为了这些，史蒂夫，王储表示他准备向美国投资6000亿美元或更多，前提是特朗普执政。

segments.text: Okay, big dollar figure.
segments.translation: 好的，这个数字真不少。

segments.text: I'm reminded, though, all politics is local and often foreign policy is domestic policy.
segments.translation: 不过让我想起一件事，所有政治都是地方性的，而许多外交政策实际上也是国内政策。

segments.text: What are the domestic calculations of each of these leaders?
segments.translation: 这些领导人各自的国内考量是什么？

segments.text: Okay, this visit is important for both.
segments.translation: 好的，这次访问对双方来说都很重要。

segments.text: First of all, it gives Trump a chance to turn those headlines away from the Jeffrey Epstein emails and the challenges within his own party over that to multi-billion dollar investments that he says create jobs in the US and herald the US return of global superiority over China and Russia.
segments.translation: 首先，这次访问给特朗普一个机会，让媒体的焦点从杰弗里·爱泼斯坦的邮件和他自己党内的挑战上转移到他所说的能够在美国创造就业机会的数十亿美元投资上，并预示着美国在与中国和俄罗斯的竞争中重拾全球领先地位。

segments.text: You know, the MAGA message.
segments.translation: 你知道的，MAGA的信息。

segments.text: Now, for the prince, this is a turning point.
segments.translation: 对于这位王子来说，这是一个转折点。

segments.text: It is his first time back in Washington since 2018 when that Saudi critic and Washington Post columnist Jamal Khashoggi was killed by the prince's aides in an operation that the CIA says he approved.
segments.translation: 自2018年以来，他首次回到华盛顿，当时沙特批评者、华盛顿邮报专栏作家贾马尔·哈苏吉被王储的助手杀害，中央情报局称这是王储批准的行动。

segments.text: The crown prince, also known as MBS, has denied that.
segments.translation: 王储，也被称为MBS，否认了这一点。

segments.text: And there is a continued clampdown on perceived critics in the kingdom, including travel bans that are still imposed on women's rights activists.
segments.translation: 在这个王国里，对被视为批评者的打压依然持续，包括对女性权利活动家的旅行禁令仍在实施。

segments.text: But he is a popular leader among young Saudis.
segments.translation: 但他在年轻的沙特人中十分受欢迎。

segments.text: Steve, I was just in Saudi last month speaking with Saudis of all ages, and they say there are soaring rents in Riyadh right now, and that's worrying to them.
segments.translation: 史蒂夫，我上个月刚去沙特，和各个年龄段的沙特人聊过，他们说现在利雅得的房租飙升，这让他们很担忧。

segments.text: But they say he has transformed the country and he's turning Riyadh into a kind of global city like Dubai with plans to host the World Expo and the FIFA World Cup.
segments.translation: 但他们说他已经改变了这个国家，并正在将利雅得打造成为一个像迪拜那样的全球城市，计划举办世博会和国际足联世界杯。

segments.text: But he's going to need companies to also invest in Saudi Arabia, too, to create jobs for Saudis and to keep pace with these massive reforms.
segments.translation: 但他还需要公司在沙特阿拉伯投资，以为沙特人创造就业机会，并跟上这些大规模改革的步伐。

segments.text: I'm thinking about the way the president makes diplomacy personal.
segments.translation: 我在想，总统是如何将外交变得个人化的。

segments.text: It's about him and the other leader.
segments.translation: 这关乎他和其他领导人。

segments.text: You can picture him saying, look, Crown Prince, here's where I'm building my ballroom.
segments.translation: 你可以想象他对王储说，听着，王储，这里就是我正在打造的舞会大厅。

segments.text: What's the relationship like?
segments.translation: 你们的关系怎么样？

segments.text: Yes, you know, the president has leaned on those ties with Gulf Arab rulers in particular for a range of issues like his Gaza ceasefire plan and the 22 point peace plan right now.
segments.translation: 是的，你知道，总统在多方面的问题上，特别是与海湾阿拉伯统治者的关系上，施加了压力，比如他的加沙停火计划和目前的22点和平计划。

segments.text: But there are also billions of dollars meanwhile, you know, from golf money flowing into his family's business ventures.
segments.translation: 但是与此同时，你知道，从高尔夫的钱中涌入他家族生意的资金也有数十亿。

segments.text: And that includes Trump branded golf courses and towers being built in Saudi Arabia and across the Gulf by a Saudi developer.
segments.translation: 这包括在沙特阿拉伯和海湾地区由一位沙特开发商兴建的特朗普品牌高尔夫球场和塔楼。

segments.text: Now, the White House says that and other business deals are not a conflict of interest and that the president gave up a life of luxury for public service.
segments.translation: 现在，白宫表示这些商业交易并不构成利益冲突，并且总统为了公共服务放弃了奢华的生活。

segments.text: But analysts that I've spoken to in the Gulf say, you know, the leaders in this region are simply leveraging a transactional relationship while Trump's in office.
segments.translation: 但是我在海湾地区接触的分析人士表示，这里的领导人只是利用了一种交易关系，趁着特朗普执政期间。

segments.text: And they know very well that election cycles can bring a change in mood in Washington on a dime.
segments.translation: 他们非常清楚，选举周期可以瞬间改变华盛顿的气氛。

segments.text: NPR International correspondent Aya Batraoui in Dubai.
segments.translation: NPR国际记者Aya Batraoui在迪拜。

segments.text: Thanks so much.
segments.translation: 非常感谢。

segments.text: Thanks, Steve.
segments.translation: 谢谢，史蒂夫。

segments.text: And that's a first for this Tuesday, November 18th.
segments.translation: 这是11月18日星期二的首次报道。

segments.text: I'm Steve Inskeep.
segments.translation: 我是史蒂夫·印斯基普。

segments.text: So many options to get the news you need to start your day, so go on and get it.
segments.translation: 有很多方式可以获取你开始一天所需的新闻，去吧，去获取吧。

segments.text: I just pick up a phone and call Lee Martinez.
segments.translation: 我只是拿起电话给李·马丁内斯打个电话。

segments.text: I ask you, that's my option.
segments.translation: 我问你，这是我的选择。

segments.text: Hey, what's up?
segments.translation: 嘿，怎么了？

segments.text: Today's Up First was edited by Kelsey Snell, Megan Pratz, Rebecca Rossman, Mohammed El-Bardisi, and Alice Wolfley.
segments.translation: 今天的《优先新闻》由凯尔西·斯内尔、梅根·普拉特兹、丽贝卡·罗斯曼、穆罕默德·艾尔-巴尔迪西和爱丽丝·沃夫利编辑。

segments.text: It was produced by Ziad Butch, Nia Dumas, and Christopher Thomas, who was a little impatient with me this morning because I've been very slow to get going.
segments.translation: 今天的节目由Ziad Butch、Nia Dumas和Christopher Thomas制作，今天早上他对我有点不耐烦，因为我起得很慢。

segments.text: We get engineering support from Stacey Abbott, and our technical director is the always patient, Carly Strange.
segments.translation: 我们得到了斯泰西·阿博特的工程支持，我们的技术总监是永远耐心的卡莉·斯特兰奇。

segments.text: Join us tomorrow.
segments.translation: 明天请和我们一起收听。

segments.text: Want to hear this podcast without sponsor breaks?
segments.translation: 想无广告听这个播客吗？

segments.text: Amazon Prime members can listen to Up First sponsor free through Amazon Music.
segments.translation: 亚马逊Prime会员可以通过亚马逊音乐收听《Up First》，无需听广告。

segments.text: Or you can also support NPR's vital journalism and get Up First Plus at plus.npr.org.
segments.translation: 或者你还可以支持NPR的重要新闻报道，并在plus.npr.org获取Up First Plus。

segments.text: That's plus.npr.org.
segments.translation: 那就是plus.npr.org。

segments.text: So I just want to check in really quick.
segments.translation: 我想快速确认一下。

segments.text: Are you okay?
segments.translation: 你还好吗？

segments.text: Or are you suffering from sleep deprivation, a stack of bills, or political propaganda?
segments.translation: 或者你是在忍受失眠、堆积如山的账单，或者是政治宣传的困扰？

segments.text: If so, you may be stuck in the parent trap.
segments.translation: 如果是这样，你可能陷入了为人父母的困境。

segments.text: On the It's Been a Minute podcast, we're diving head first into the anxieties of modern parenting and how that trickles out to all of us, even if you don't have children.
segments.translation: 在《过了一会儿》播客中，我们将深入探讨现代育儿的焦虑，以及这些焦虑如何影响到我们每一个人，即便你没有孩子。

segments.text: Come find some relief.
segments.translation: 来找到一些缓解吧。

segments.text: Listen to the It's Been a Minute podcast on the NPR app or wherever you get your podcasts.
segments.translation: 在NPR应用程序或任何播客平台上收听《It's Been a Minute》播客。
